{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fine needle aspiration cytology (FNAC) is a valuable diagnostic tool for evaluating thyroid nodules. However, there are certain limitations to FNAC in diagnosing specific types of thyroid carcinoma. Based on the provided documents, FNAC may have difficulty in diagnosing follicular carcinoma of the thyroid (Choice B) and anaplastic carcinoma of the thyroid (Choice C). Papillary carcinoma of the thyroid (Choice A) and medullary carcinoma of the thyroid (Choice D) can often be diagnosed using FNAC. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Follicular carcinoma of thyroid.", "answer_choice": "B"}
